message: Look in cuda dir for opencl headers
atoms and residues are functions  not descriptors.

A large number of unit cleanups and fix numpy wart
Add test for numpy units and update user's guide docs.

Delete now out-of-date docs as well as adding __array_priority__ to Quantity. This should be *lower* than that of Unit (and ScaledUnit/BaseUnit)  since we still want Units to take priority over Quantities (but Quantity to take precedence over regular ndarrays) for reasons like this:
Don't run tests that are known to fail due to numpy bug for buggy versions of numpy.

Fix Python 3 support in unit package.

Add a test for AmoebaAngleForce. There's a problem here  though  since the input angles are in degrees (unlike *every* other angle force out there)  and stripUnits automatically reduces all angles to radians if they come in with units.
Make return units for AmoebaGeneralizedKirkwoodForce consistent with what the docstring says it should be (kJ/nm^2) -- the swig input generator had the inverse.
Add tests for AmoebaInPlaneAngleForce and add return units to the Taylor expansion coefficients.

Get the out of plane bend taylor coefficient units sorted out.
